intro: Amoria isthmocarpa, commonly known as the Isthmocarp sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or dry soils, often in open woodlands or along roadsides. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Amoria isthmocarpa is generally low-growing and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
